Description: Lower body sherd of Fikellura pottery amphora; pale slip; glaze fired red-brown; exterior, from top: palmette and tendril frize with floral filling decoration; maeander frieze; lotus flower and bud frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Written in ink on the back of the sherd is an old British Museum accession number: 1924,1201.1051. For similarities, see Reading Ure Museum 26.2.55.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 245)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.058)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 1924,0201.1051 (former British Museum registration number)
